info.title: NFL v3 Scores
info.description: NFL schedules, scores, odds, weather, and news API.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Gets all active teams.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Get bye weeks for the teams during a specified NFL season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

get.description: Year of the current NFL season. This value changes on July 1st. The earliest season for Fantasy data is 2001. The earliest season for Team data is 1985. The earliest season for Fantasy data is 2001. The earliest season for Team data is 1985.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Number of the current week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Game scores for a specified season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Year of the most recently completed season. this value changes immediately after the Super Bowl. The earliest season for Fantasy data is 2001. The earliest season for Team data is 1985.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Number of the current week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Each NFL player has a unique ID assigned by FantasyData. Player IDs can be determined by pulling player related data. Example:14257.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the team. Example: WAS.

get.description: Game schedule for a specified season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Get game scores for a specified week of a season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

get.description: Get detailed information about past, present, and future timeframes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of timeframes to return. Valid entries are current or upcoming or completed or recent or all.

get.description: Year of the current NFL season, if we are in the mid-season. If we are in the off-season, then year of the next upcoming season. This value changes immediately after the Super Bowl. The earliest season for Fantasy data is 2001. The earliest season for Team data is 1985.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Number of the current week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Gets simulated live scores of NFL games, covering the Conference Championship games on January 21, 2018.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: numberofplays
parameters.description: The number of plays to progress in this NFL live game simulation. Example entries are 0, 1, 2, 3, 150, 200, etc.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Each NFL player has a unique ID assigned by FantasyData. Player IDs can be determined by pulling player related data. Example:732.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the team. Example: WAS.
